cab.content: S document^ISJCHS PROPERTY OP HIS BRITAIN 10 MAJESTY1 S GOvERNMMT) .A R T I C Em S______pJ?____AGREEMENT .The accompanying copy of the Articles of Agreement between the British Government and the Governments,of the Irish Free State and of "Northern Ireland, signed in the Prime Minister's Room, House of Commons., at 8,0 p0ms on Thursday, December 3rd, 1925, is circulated for record.CABINET.p0 511(25).IRISH NEGOTIATIONS.(Signed) To JONES ( " ) A.P. hemisphere, ) British ffifl NGo) Se oretaries.p Whitehall Gardens, S.W..1. December 4th, 1925. Agreement amending and supplementing the Articles of Agreement for a Treaty between Great -Britain and Ireland to which the force of law was given by the Irish free State (Agreement) Act, 1922, and by the Constitution of the Irish Free State (Saorstat Eireann) Act, 1922oWHEREAS on the sixth (3ay of December ninetaon hundred and tweaty-one Articles of Agreement for a Treaty between Great Britain and Ireland wero entered intetAND WEERE&S the said Articles of Agreement were duly ratified and given the forces of law by the Irish Free State (Agreement) Aot9 19220 and by the Constitution of the Irish Free Stato (Saorstat Eireann. Aot6 1922;AMD WHEREAS tha pregrosa of events and the Improved relations now subsisting betweon tho British Government, the Govez-nment of the Irish Free State, and "the Government of Northern Ireland, and their respective peoples, make It desirable te amend and suppls-ment the said Articles of Agreement, so as to avoid any causes of frietion which might mar or retard the further growth of friendly relations between tho said governments and peoples:AND WHEREAS the British Government and the Government of tho Irish Free State being united in amity in this undertaking with the Government of Northern Ireland, and being rosolrod rautually to aid ono another in a spirit of neighbourly comradeship, hereby agree es follows!-I. The powors conferred by the proviso to Article 12 of the said Articles of Agreement on the CommissioH therein mentioned ara horeby revoked, and the extent of Northern Ireland for the purposes of the Government of Ire3.and Aot, 1920, and of the said Artioles of Agreement,, shall be such- as was fixed lay sub-section (2) of seotion one of that Aot.2. The Irish Free Stato is hereby released from the obligation under Artiole & Gf the said Articles of Agreement to assume the liability therein mentioned. 3o The Irish Free State hereby assumes all liability undertaken "by the British Government in respect of malicious damage done since the twenty first day of January nineteen hundred and nineteen to property in the area now under the jurisdiction of the parliament and Government of the Irish Free State, and the Government of the Irish Free state shall repay to the British Government, at such time or times and in such manner as may be agreed upon, moneys already paid "by the British Government in respect of such damage, or liable to be so paid under obligations already incurred.,4. The Government of the Irish Free State hereby agrees to promote legislation increasing by ten per cent the measure of compensation under the Damage to property (Compensation) Act, 19?.3, in respect of malicious damage to property done in the area now under the jurisdiction of the parliament and Government of the Irish Free State between the eleventh day of July, nineteen hundred and twenty one. and the twelfth day of May. nineteen hundred and twenty-three,, and providing for the payment of such, additional compensation by the issue of Five per cent compensation Stock or 30nds.5. The powers in relation to U0rthern Ireland which by the Government of Ireland Act, 1920, are made powers of the Council of Ireland, shall be and are hereby transferred to and shall become powers of the parliament and the Government of N0rthern Ireland; and the Governments of the Irish Free State and. of lT0rthern Ireland shall meet together as and when necessary/ for the purpose of considering matters of common interest arising out of or connected with the exercise and administration of the said powers. 6o This Agreement is subject to confirmation by the British Parliament and by the Oiroachtas of the Irish Free State, and the Act of the British Parliament con-firming this Agreement shall fix the date as from which the transfer of the powers of the Council of Ireland under this Agreement is to take effect9Dated this 3rd day of December, 1925,Signed on behalf of the British Governments:ANLEY BALDWIN. INSTON S. CHURCHILL. . JOYNSON-HICKS. IRKENHEAD. .S. AMERY.Signed on behalf of the Government of the Irish Free StateoWILLIAM T. COSGRAVE. KEVIN 05HIGGINS.ERNEST BLITHE.Signed on behalf of the Government of Northern Ireland,JAMES CRAIG.CHAR LES H.BLACKMORE secretary to the Cabinet of Northern Ireland.Signed In Irish characters,
